body_html:
Training is in Python because each step interacts with other Python libraries. Mujoco, gym and Universe have Python bindings. C++ bindings are either not as well tested (people tend to use Mujoco through Python) or missing completely (gym + universe).

Partial run would help if I needed to persist some Tensors between run calls. But here I'm injecting new data each time. I can see how Mujoco C++ op would be more efficient but going down that route seems a bit scary

Partial run would help if I needed to persist some Tensors between run calls. But here I'm injecting new data each time. I can see how Mujoco C++ op would be more efficient but going down that route seems a bit scary
body:
Training is in Python because each step interacts with other Python libraries. Mujoco, [gym](https://gym.openai.com/) and [Universe](https://universe.openai.com/) have  Python bindings. C++ bindings are either not as well tested (people tend to use Mujoco through Python) or missing completely (gym + universe).

Partial run would help if I needed to persist some Tensors between run calls. But here I'm injecting new data each time. I can see how Mujoco C++ op would be more efficient but going down that route seems a bit scary
